prop.name: vehicleSpecialUsage
prop.desc: Indicates whether the vehicle has been used for special purposes, like commercial rental, driving school, or as a taxi. The legislation in many countries requires this information to be revealed when offering a car for sale.

prop.name: numberOfForwardGears
prop.desc:
The total number of forward gears available for the transmission system of the vehicle.

Typical unit code(s): C62

prop.name: mileageFromOdometer
prop.desc:
The total distance travelled by the particular vehicle since its initial production, as read from its odometer.

Typical unit code(s): KMT for kilometers, SMI for statute miles

prop.name: vehicleInteriorColor
prop.desc: The color or color combination of the interior of the vehicle.

prop.name: steeringPosition
prop.desc: The position of the steering wheel or similar device (mostly for cars).

prop.name: vehicleEngine
prop.desc: Information about the engine or engines of the vehicle.

prop.name: vehicleModelDate
prop.desc: The release date of a vehicle model (often used to differentiate versions of the same make and model).

prop.name: numberOfDoors
prop.desc:
The number of doors.

Typical unit code(s): C62

prop.name: vehicleConfiguration
prop.desc: A short text indicating the configuration of the vehicle, e.g. '5dr hatchback ST 2.5 MT 225 hp' or 'limited edition'.

prop.name: fuelType
prop.desc: The type of fuel suitable for the engine or engines of the vehicle. If the vehicle has only one engine, this property can be attached directly to the vehicle.

prop.name: vehicleIdentificationNumber
prop.desc: The Vehicle Identification Number (VIN) is a unique serial number used by the automotive industry to identify individual motor vehicles.

prop.name: fuelConsumption
prop.desc:
The amount of fuel consumed for traveling a particular distance or temporal duration with the given vehicle (e.g. liters per 100 km).

  • Note 1: There are unfortunately no standard unit codes for liters per 100 km. Use unitText to indicate the unit of measurement, e.g. L/100 km.
  • Note 2: There are two ways of indicating the fuel consumption, fuelConsumption (e.g. 8 liters per 100 km) and fuelEfficiency (e.g. 30 miles per gallon). They are reciprocal.
  • Note 3: Often, the absolute value is useful only when related to driving speed ("at 80 km/h") or usage pattern ("city traffic"). You can use valueReference to link the value for the fuel consumption to another value.

prop.name: numberOfPreviousOwners
prop.desc:
The number of owners of the vehicle, including the current one.

Typical unit code(s): C62

prop.name: fuelEfficiency
prop.desc:
The distance traveled per unit of fuel used; most commonly miles per gallon (mpg) or kilometers per liter (km/L).

  • Note 1: There are unfortunately no standard unit codes for miles per gallon or kilometers per liter. Use unitText to indicate the unit of measurement, e.g. mpg or km/L.
  • Note 2: There are two ways of indicating the fuel consumption, fuelConsumption (e.g. 8 liters per 100 km) and fuelEfficiency (e.g. 30 miles per gallon). They are reciprocal.
  • Note 3: Often, the absolute value is useful only when related to driving speed ("at 80 km/h") or usage pattern ("city traffic"). You can use valueReference to link the value for the fuel economy to another value.

prop.name: numberOfAxles
prop.desc:
The number of axles.

Typical unit code(s): C62

prop.name: vehicleInteriorType
prop.desc: The type or material of the interior of the vehicle (e.g. synthetic fabric, leather, wood, etc.). While most interior types are characterized by the material used, an interior type can also be based on vehicle usage or target audience.

prop.name: knownVehicleDamages
prop.desc: A textual description of known damages, both repaired and unrepaired.

prop.name: numberOfAirbags
prop.desc: The number or type of airbags in the vehicle.

prop.name: vehicleSeatingCapacity
prop.desc:
The number of passengers that can be seated in the vehicle, both in terms of the physical space available, and in terms of limitations set by law.

Typical unit code(s): C62 for persons.

prop.name: cargoVolume
prop.desc:
The available volume for cargo or luggage. For automobiles, this is usually the trunk volume.

Typical unit code(s): LTR for liters, FTQ for cubic foot/feet

Note: You can use minValue and maxValue to indicate ranges.

prop.name: vehicleTransmission
prop.desc: The type of component used for transmitting the power from a rotating power source to the wheels or other relevant component(s) ("gearbox" for cars).

prop.name: dateVehicleFirstRegistered
prop.desc: The date of the first registration of the vehicle with the respective public authorities.

prop.name: purchaseDate
prop.desc: The date the item e.g. vehicle was purchased by the current owner.

prop.name: productionDate
prop.desc: The date of production of the item, e.g. vehicle.

prop.name: driveWheelConfiguration
prop.desc: The drive wheel configuration, i.e. which roadwheels will receive torque from the vehicle's engine via the drivetrain.

Product.name: manufacturer
Product.desc: The manufacturer of the product.

Product.name: sku
Product.desc: The Stock Keeping Unit (SKU), i.e. a merchant-specific identifier for a product or service, or the product to which the offer refers.

Product.name: audience
Product.desc: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.

Product.name: mpn
Product.desc: The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) of the product, or the product to which the offer refers.

Product.name: height
Product.desc: The height of the item.

Product.name: gtin8
Product.desc: The GTIN-8 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This code is also known as EAN/UCC-8 or 8-digit EAN. See GS1 GTIN Summary for more details.

Product.name: reviews
Product.desc: Review of the item.

Product.name: aggregateRating
Product.desc: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

Product.name: isConsumableFor
Product.desc: A pointer to another product (or multiple products) for which this product is a consumable.

Product.name: offers
Product.desc: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event.

Product.name: award
Product.desc: An award won by or for this item.

Product.name: category
Product.desc: A category for the item. Greater signs or slashes can be used to informally indicate a category hierarchy.

Product.name: width
Product.desc: The width of the item.

Product.name: awards
Product.desc: Awards won by or for this item.

Product.name: additionalProperty
Product.desc:
A property-value pair representing an additional characteristics of the entitity, e.g. a product feature or another characteristic for which there is no matching property in schema.org.

Note: Publishers should be aware that applications designed to use specific schema.org properties (e.g. http://schema.org/width, http://schema.org/color, http://schema.org/gtin13, ...) will typically expect such data to be provided using those properties, rather than using the generic property/value mechanism.

Product.name: isAccessoryOrSparePartFor
Product.desc: A pointer to another product (or multiple products) for which this product is an accessory or spare part.

Product.name: logo
Product.desc: An associated logo.

Product.name: gtin14
Product.desc: The GTIN-14 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. See GS1 GTIN Summary for more details.

Product.name: gtin13
Product.desc: The GTIN-13 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This is equivalent to 13-digit ISBN codes and EAN UCC-13. Former 12-digit UPC codes can be converted into a GTIN-13 code by simply adding a preceeding zero. See GS1 GTIN Summary for more details.

Product.name: gtin12
Product.desc: The GTIN-12 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. The GTIN-12 is the 12-digit GS1 Identification Key composed of a U.P.C. Company Prefix, Item Reference, and Check Digit used to identify trade items. See GS1 GTIN Summary for more details.

Product.name: material
Product.desc: A material that something is made from, e.g. leather, wool, cotton, paper.

Product.name: weight
Product.desc: The weight of the product or person.

Product.name: depth
Product.desc: The depth of the item.

Product.name: isSimilarTo
Product.desc: A pointer to another, functionally similar product (or multiple products).

Product.name: model
Product.desc: The model of the product. Use with the URL of a ProductModel or a textual representation of the model identifier. The URL of the ProductModel can be from an external source. It is recommended to additionally provide strong product identifiers via the gtin8/gtin13/gtin14 and mpn properties.

Product.name: color
Product.desc: The color of the product.

Product.name: isRelatedTo
Product.desc: A pointer to another, somehow related product (or multiple products).

Product.name: productID
Product.desc: The product identifier, such as ISBN. For example: meta itemprop="productID" content="isbn:123-456-789".

Product.name: review
Product.desc: A review of the item.

Product.name: purchaseDate
Product.desc: The date the item e.g. vehicle was purchased by the current owner.

Product.name: itemCondition
Product.desc: A predefined value from OfferItemCondition or a textual description of the condition of the product or service, or the products or services included in the offer.

Product.name: productionDate
Product.desc: The date of production of the item, e.g. vehicle.

Product.name: brand
Product.desc: The brand(s) associated with a product or service, or the brand(s) maintained by an organization or business person.

Product.name: releaseDate
Product.desc: The release date of a product or product model. This can be used to distinguish the exact variant of a product.
